Package CAMs

Class Camp

java.lang.Object
CAMs.Camp
public class Camp extends Object
Includes information of all the camps including list of students registered as attendees and camp committee
Since:
2023-11-25
Version:
3.0
Author:
Jeevika, Mathangi, Teja, Vikaas

  • Field Details

    • totalCamps

      public int totalCamps
      Integer value that holds the total number of camps. Initially this is zero.

    • slotsAvailable

      public int slotsAvailable
      Integer value that holds the available slots.

    • totalSlots

      public int totalSlots
      Integer value that holds the total number of slots.

    • staffIncharge

      public CAMs.Staff staffIncharge
      Represents the staff that is incharge.

    • input

      public static Scanner input
      Static Scanner object for reading input from the standard input (System.in).

    • inputErrorChecking

      public static CAMs.InputErrorChecking inputErrorChecking
      Static instance used to perform validation and error checking on user inputs.

  • Constructor Details

    • Camp

      public Camp(String campName, String openDate, String closeDate, String regCloseDate, CAMs.CampAvailability campAccessible, CAMs.Schools campSchool, String location, int totalSlots, String description, CAMs.Staff staffIncharge, boolean visibility)
      Constructs new Camp with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      campName - The name of the camp.
      openDate - The opening date of the camp in the format "yyyy-mm-dd".
      closeDate - The closing date of the camp in the format "yyyy-mm-dd".
      regCloseDate - The registration closing date of the camp in the format "yyyy-mm-dd".
      campAccessible - The availability status of the camp.
      campSchool - The school associated with the camp.
      location - The location of the camp.
      totalSlots - The total number of slots available in the camp.
      description - The description of the camp.
      staffIncharge - The staff member in charge of the camp.
      visibility - The visibility status of the camp for students.
